hotspots.label: Birds in Flight
hotspots.fact: These birds are likely geese or cranes migrating to find food and better weather. Birds fly in formation to save energy by drafting off each other, kind of like how cyclists ride close together!

hotspots.label: Flock on Ground
hotspots.fact: Large flocks gather in open fields to rest and feed during migration. These birds can travel thousands of miles, stopping at fields like this to refuel with seeds and plants.

hotspots.label: Agricultural Field
hotspots.fact: Harvested farm fields provide perfect resting spots for migrating birds. The leftover seeds and grains give birds the energy they need for their long journeys between summer and winter homes.

hotspots.label: Power Lines
hotspots.fact: Birds often perch on power lines and utility structures to rest and observe their surroundings. These human-made structures have become natural gathering spots for migratory birds across the continent.
